content.description: Follows 2 bolts straight up, then left into a scoop and back slightly right up to the anchors. First two bolts are obvious from the ground, but upper three bolts not easily visible (placed in depressions). A couple different cruxes keep this short route interesting.
content.location: Leftmost route at the crag. Starts just a few feet left of Such a Karen, and about 20 feet left of the big multi-armed saguaro.

content.description: Climb up past three bolts to a small ledge and a small left facing corner in the middle of the face. Then up and slightly left to the anchors. A couple cruxes keep it interesting throughout.
content.location: About 15 feet right of Super Spreader, and just a few feet left of Lockdown. The second route from the right of the five routes that are on this main part of the formation.

content.description: Climb up just right of the saguaro, which is right of the large tree at the base of the crag. Pass a tricky bulge at the third bolt, and be careful of the saguaro here. Then up and diagonally right after the 5th bolt. Two cruxes - one at the lower bulge, and a second near the anchors.
content.location: Start just right of the saguaro which is right of the tree at the base of the crag.

content.description: Continuous and good climbing up nice orange rock on the left side of the crag. Harder and steeper than it looks.
content.location: Left side of the crag, about 15 feet left of the large multi-armed saguaro at the base.

content.description: This route goes over three distinct bulges, which get progressively more difficult, with good rests between each bulge. The upper crux is steep, fun and easier than it looks. Fun route.
content.location: This route is the second route in from the right at the main crag. Starts about 10 feet left of Double Dose.

content.description: For a very short route, this is surprisingly good and consistent. Good rock and very fun climbing. Crux up high. Good warm up for the rest of the crag.
content.location: Located on a short wall which is right of the main crag. Walk easily uphill past the main crag to get to this short, banded face.

content.description: Starts up easy ground past the right side of the cave, passing one bolt. Above, there are two lines of bolts - this route takes the right hand line of bolts. Follow steep ground and fun climbing to the anchors. Some chossy rock at the start of the steep section, but it quickly improves. A couple early bolts are very closely spaced to keep you off the ledge, and to help with the insecurity of the rock.
content.location: Start behind the large tree at the base of the center of the crag. Approach the start from the left side of the tree. One bolt in the lower section below the cave marks the start. Above, there are two lines of bolts on the steep wall. This route takes the right line of bolts. The left line of bolts is Just the Two of Us. Both routes share the first bolt in the easy section.

content.description: Up and slightly right in a shallow corner to start, then straight up to the anchors. Steep continuous climbing, especially on the upper half.
content.location: The third route right of the saguaro, which is right of the tree at the base of the crag.

content.description: Shares the first bolt with Quaranteam, up an easy section to the base of the steeper rock. Then continuous, good climbing on overhanging rock out the right side of the cave. A little bit of chossy rock as you start the steep section, but the rock quickly improves. Probably just a bit harder than Quaranteam. Too bad the steep section is not a bit longer.
content.location: Starts behind the tree in the center of the crag. Enter from the left side. Shares the first bolt with Quaranteam up an easy section. Then takes the left of two bolt lines up the short steep wall to the right of the cave.

climbs.name: Double Dose
climbs.fa: Don Wilson, Karen Wilson, Cat Crawford, Brian Kennedy, March 2021

content.description: The right most route on the main crag.  Starts up nice steep orange rock, up to the cave at 2/3 height.  Good rest at the cave, then a steep boulder problem crux up to the anchor.
content.location: Right most route at the main crag. Easily identified by the cave at 2/3 height.

content.description: A fun winter crag with vertical to slightly overhanging routes up a 30 to 50 foot wall. Nice selection of grades from 5.8 to 5.11. Shade until about 11 am, then sun all day. Rock quality is mostly good, but expect some loose rock as is typical of lower highway crags, especially when new. All routes are bolted and have quick lower anchors. Nice hang and great views. Belayers are advised to wear a helmet.
